title: Variables
summary: Variables are containers for storing data values. Think of them like labeled boxes where you can put information to use later in your program.
sample_question: In your own words, what is a variable, and can you give a real-world analogy for it?

title: Loops
summary: Loops allow you to repeat a block of code multiple times. This saves you from writing the same code over and over again.
sample_question: What is the primary difference between a 'for' loop and a 'while' loop?

title: Functions
summary: A function is a block of code which only runs when it is called. You can pass data, known as parameters, into a function.
sample_question: Why do we use functions instead of writing all our code in one big block?
